basics.name: Chung-Nan Tsai
basics.label: Senior Data Scientist
basics.summary: Results-driven Data Science leader with over 10 years of progressive experience in data analytics, application and product development, and customer technical support. Proven track record of delivering impactful solutions that enhance operational efficiency and drive customer growth.

work.name: Lam Research Japan
work.summary: Advocating for and leading a cross-regional Digital Transformation (DX) initiative for APAC customer service operations (Japan, China, Taiwan), driving process innovation, enhancing productivity, and achieving operational excellence.
highlights: As the lead software developer, drove the end-to-end development of an Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) system—from a frontend Single-Page Application (SPA) to a robust Django backend API service following the MVT design pattern—scaling it from 0→1 into a production-ready platform with 500+ daily users across key operational sites.

Architected and deployed a production system for equipment monitoring and maintenance, transitioning from Excel to digital platforms. This reduced workflow time by 90% and improved operational efficiency by 40%, enabling real-time KPI tracking.

Developed an LLM-powered AI chat agent for critical tool maintenance, integrating Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with the LangChain framework to significantly improve diagnostic precision, expedite troubleshooting processes, and reduce equipment downtime.
Awarded the Employee of the Quarter for 2023-2024 in the Japan region.

Led a team of 4 in the Japan region for the application development of Lam’s AI data analytics system to improve customers’ installed base etch and deposition equipment performance for fleet productivity, uptime, and throughput via the analysis of equipment sensor data from semiconductor manufacturing equipment.

work.name: Tokyo Electron Ltd
highlights: Developed high-impact data analytics solutions using Python, R, and KNIME, building interactive dashboards and custom applications to drive data-driven decision-making.

work.name: ASML US
work.summary: Worked on the development and optimization of ASML’s optical metrology systems. Delivered data-driven insights and product recommendations to support strategic decisions, improve tool performance, and enhance customer satisfaction.
highlights: Led development of optical metrology applications for Overlay/OCD monitoring.
Provided actionable data analysis to support strategic product and customer decisions.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to enhance the performance of current and next-generation metrology tools.
Improved customer satisfaction by delivering technical solutions aligned with client needs.

work.name: KLA Taiwan
work.summary: Developed and optimized KLA’s metrology solutions for leading semiconductor customers. Focused on recipe development, SEM imaging, and technical engagement to improve tool performance and drive manufacturing efficiency.
highlights: Increased metrology tool utilization for TSMC by delivering high-quality recipe development and SEM imaging optimization.
Collaborated closely with TSMC's metrology team to resolve technical challenges and enhance system performance.
Achieved a 30% cycle time reduction, directly contributing to improved IC manufacturing efficiency.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
